channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Product Enquiry for WooCommerce
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Product Enquiry for WooCommerce

item.title: CVE-2023-6626|2024-08-02T08:35:14.884Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.1 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2023-6625|2024-08-02T08:35:14.890Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.1 does not have a CSRF check in place when deleting inquiries, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin delete them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2023-7151|2024-08-02T08:50:08.190Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.2 does not sanitise and escape the page parameter before outputting it back in an attribute, leading to a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting which could be used against high privilege users such as admin

item.title: CVE-2024-3964|2024-08-01T20:26:57.228Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.1.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3964|2024-07-13T06:00:05.478Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.1.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)

item.title: CVE-2024-3964|2024-07-16T13:56:58.674Z -- unknown -- product%20enquiry%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: The Product Enquiry for WooCommerce WordPress plugin before 3.1.8 does not sanitise and escape some of its settings, which could allow high privilege users such as admin to perform Stored Cross-Site Scripting attacks even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed (for example in multisite setup)
